abstract.p: French insurer Axa SA agrees to pay $3.79 billion in cash for 44.7 percent stake in does not already own in Sun Life and Provincial Holdings PLC of Britain, valuing Sun Life at more than $8.2 billion; graph (S)

block.p: The French insurer Axa S.A. agreed to pay $3.79 billion in cash for the 44.7 percent stake it did not already own in Sun Life and Provincial Holdings P.L.C. of Britain, valuing Sun Life at more than $8.2 billion. Sun Life shareholders will also receive a special divided equivalent to about 8 cents per ordinary share when the deal is completed. Sun Life said the offer represented a premium of 54.1 percent over its shares' closing price on March 23, before Axa and Sun Life announced they were in talks.
